unnormalised: What's the craziest thing you've seen happen during college admissions in India?
normalised: What is the craziest thing you have seen happen during college admissions in India?

unnormalised: Okay, so I have this friend, right? Let's call him Rohan (because that's his name). Rohan applied to every engineering college under the sun – IIT Delhi, IIT Bombay, VIT Vellore, you name it. JEE Main rank? Solid, but not "President of India" solid. Anyway, the day results came out, he was refreshing the page like it was a Salman Khan movie release. Finally, it pops! He gets a seat... at a college he *swears* he never applied to. Like, "Shri Shri Institute of Underwater Basket Weaving" levels of obscure. Turns out his super-helpful uncle, in his infinite wisdom, thought Rohan needed "backup options" and applied on his behalf to approx. 17 more places. Rohan nearly had a heart attack.
normalised: Okay, so I have this friend, right? Let us call him Rohan (because that is his name). Rohan applied to every engineering college under the sun – I-I-T Delhi, I-I-T Bombay, V-I-T Vellore, you name it. J-E-E Main rank? Solid, but not "President of India" solid. Anyway, the day results came out, he was refreshing the page like it was a Salman Khan movie release. Finally, it pops! He gets a seat... at a college he swears he never applied to. Like, "Shri Shri Institute of Underwater Basket Weaving" levels of obscure. Turns out his super-helpful uncle, in his infinite wisdom, thought Rohan needed "backup options" and applied on his behalf to approximately seventeen more places. Rohan nearly had a heart attack.

unnormalised: The fun didn't stop there. To withdraw from this... institution, he had to go through a whole song and dance. Think multiple affidavits, notarized documents, and a personal appearance before a committee of professors who looked like they hadn't seen sunlight since 1998. The entire process cost him ₹5000 and one precious week of chai-drinking time.
normalised: The fun did not stop there. To withdraw from this... institution, he had to go through a whole song and dance. Think multiple affidavits, notarized documents, and a personal appearance before a committee of professors who looked like they had not seen sunlight since one thousand nine hundred and ninety eight. The entire process cost him rupee five thousand and one precious week of chai-drinking time.

unnormalised: Moral of the story? Love your family, but double-check their college application strategies. Also, maybe consider underwater basket weaving? Who knows, might be the next big thing. BTW, Rohan ended up at a decent NIT with CSE. All's well that ends well, I guess. But that withdrawal process? Still gives him nightmares, he says.
normalised: Moral of the story? Love your family, but double-check their college application strategies. Also, maybe consider underwater basket weaving? Who knows, might be the next big thing. By the way, Rohan ended up at a decent N-I-T with C-S-E. All is well that ends well, I guess. But that withdrawal process? Still gives him nightmares, he says.
